image.altText: Two people in defence uniforms, standing near a row of aircraft on a large ship.

props.synopsis: One of the British Royal Navy's two massive aircraft carriers has docked in Darwin, following the testing of missile rearming capability at the city's port.

title.children: Darwin's wartime capability tested as massive UK naval ship visits port

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is considering changing the law in an effort to drive down the costs of coronial inquests. But a lawyer from the Kumanjayi Walker probe says police used far more resources than the community.

title.children: NT government flags capping coronial spends after $8m Walker inquest

image.altText: A mum helping her young daughter use cutlery to eat a meal.

props.synopsis: The community is rallying around the family of a four-year-old girl who was killed by a falling palm tree in Darwin, with more than $94,000 donated so far to help navigate "this time of profound grief".

title.children: Support for 'deeply loved' family after 4yo girl dies in 'tragic accident'

image.altText: A man in a face mask and glasses, with cameramen and journalist holding microphones standing nearby.

props.synopsis: A newspaper delivery driver who hit and then reversed over three people late at night has avoided time in prison for fleeing the crime scene.

title.children: Delivery driver escapes jail for double fatal hit-and-run in Darwin

image.altText: A woman with curly hair wearing a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Maningrida has the highest rate of rheumatic heart disease in the world, with an imminent shortage of a drug crucial to treating the condition currently in short supply.

title.children: NT faces shortage of life-saving rheumatic heart disease medicine

image.altText: Four Indigenous leaders standing outside of Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's four Aboriginal land councils have issued a rare joint statement, accusing the NT government of ignoring the human rights of Aboriginal people.

title.children: 'So disgusting': NT's land councils issue warning against territory government

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest Aboriginal legal services is calling on the federal government to intervene in what it is calling an incarceration "crisis" in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Federal government urged to intervene in NT incarceration 'crisis'

image.altText: A man on a footy oval

props.synopsis: A ban was imposed after last year's grand final weekend coincided with increased crime and antisocial behaviour.

title.children: Bush football finals set for Alice Springs return after ban lifted

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in adverse event reports for Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Kristin Cabot was listed on the tech company's website as chief people officer, but her picture has since been removed.

title.children: Astronomer's chief HR officer resigns after Coldplay concert saga

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The former Liberal Party staffer is facing two rape charges in Toowoomba, west of Brisbane, over an alleged incident in 2021 – to which he has yet to indicate a plea.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann drops claim over 'illegally obtained' phone calls

image.altText: Penny Wong walks smiling with man in front of Sydney Opera House

props.synopsis: Britain says it will deepen its AUKUS nuclear submarine partnership with Australia through a new 50-year treaty that it expects to create jobs and boost British exports.

title.children: UK and Australia deepen AUKUS submarine pact with 50-year treaty

image.altText: A house with police tape around it and an officer standing in front of it

props.synopsis: A man dies after suffering a medical episode minutes after being tasered during an arrest in the Perth suburb of Embleton overnight, WA police say.

title.children: Man dies after being tasered by police in suburban Perth

image.altText: A man with a white moustache raises his hand in court

props.synopsis: A 2016 civil trial over coverage of Hogan's sex tape pitted the First Amendment against privacy rights — changing the world of tabloid fodder.

title.children: Hulk Hogan's greatest victory may have been inside a Florida courtroom

image.altText: An animated devil is in a bed next to an animated Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Just hours after Paramount bought global streaming rights for South Park in a billion-dollar deal, the 27th season opens with President Donald Trump begging Satan for sex.

title.children: South Park airs naked Trump parody as Paramount merges with Skydance

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Those who paid off their student loans quickly before indexation rose may regret that decision, now that HECS-HELP debts are set to be slashed by 20 per cent.

title.children: Student debt regret: What it means for those who have paid off HECS

image.altText: Psychologist holds a teenage girl's hands while balancing a clipboard on her lap.

props.synopsis: Patients and health experts say psychological screening prior to bariatric surgery may help identify people with eating disorders, and counter potential mental health impacts of the life-changing procedure.

title.children: Bariatric surgery patients at risk of eating disorders, calls for psychological screenings

image.altText: Donald Trump and Jerome Powell in white hard hats, with Powell holding a paper

props.synopsis: The US Federal Reserve chair pushes back on President Trump's criticism of renovation costs amid a campaign of growing pressure.

title.children: Trump fact-checked by Federal Reserve boss in exchange over renovations

image.altText: An elderly man sitting outdoors, smiling warmly while wearing a light gray hoodie

props.synopsis: The Walkley Award-winning journalist has been remembered as a "wonderful human being" at a heartfelt funeral in North Sydney on Friday.

title.children: ABC journalist Peter Ryan remembered as 'lovely bloke' at Sydney farewell

image.altText: A heavyset man in a dark hoodie is escorted by two officers into a police car outside an airport terminal.

props.synopsis: Joshua Wright has been sentenced to more than 17 years behind bars for the 2023 Hunter Valley murder of John Simpson.

title.children: Jail for man who shot housemate after RSPCA seized his dogs

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The ASX has ended the week in the red after a day of losses. See how the day's events and insights unfolded on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls, as mining and gold stocks weigh on share market — as it happened

image.altText: A person walks by a purple building looking at its roof that has fallen in with debris strewn inside it

props.synopsis: The bloodiest military battles in more than a decade between Thailand and Cambodia have reportedly killed at least 16 people — mostly civilians.

title.children: Thailand-Cambodia military exchanges could lead to war, acting Thai PM says

image.altText: A woman with a child sitting in her lap sits in front of a sign reading: 18 months our 3 year is waiting for his surgery.

props.synopsis: A Bendigo mother has successfully protested and her son has received surgery after an 18-month wait for a public hospital ENT appointment amid a regional specialist shortage.

title.children: Mother stages sit-in at Royal Children's Hospital to get appointment for son

image.altText: A line of large trucks carrying hay bales travel down the Eyre Highway

props.synopsis: More than 80 trucks loaded with more than 6,000 bales of hay and straw from WA is heading for drought-stricken parts of South Australia.

title.children: WA's farming community rallies to help drought-hit SA

image.altText: A plate of colourful cakes.

props.synopsis: Investigators find managers of a Chinese kindergarten allegedly bribed local officials to change the blood test results of 247 kindergarten children who had dangerously high levels of lead.

title.children: Lead poisoning investigation in China alleges cover up by kindergarten

image.altText: Ambulance vans on road with cars in background

props.synopsis: The man allegedly rammed a police vehicle and drove at the officers before two pursuit attempts and three cars were hit in Penrith.

title.children: Man arrested, critical incident declared after crash following police pursuit

image.altText: A photo taken from a plane window shows a thin river with lots of twists and turns, and native vegetation on the bank.

props.synopsis: Thirteen years since the start of the Murray-Darling Basin Plan, a comprehensive evaluation finds rivers, wetlands and lakes are in far better shape.

title.children: Positive report card for Murray-Darling Basin Plan, but not all agree

image.altText: Close up of messy kitchen utensil drawer.

props.synopsis: When balancing taking care of your cookware and your health, what should you be looking for when buying cooking utensils?

title.children: Wood, metal or plastic? Choosing the best cooking utensils

image.altText: Two men stand back while another man wields a machete.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man involved in an armed gang fight that sent Melbourne's Northland Shopping Centre into lockdown in May will be released from custody to complete community work.

title.children: Teen involved in Melbourne shopping centre gang fight released from custody

image.altText: Aerial shot of a beach in Phuket, Thailand with tourists swimming in the water and sunbathing

props.synopsis: Staff at a hotel in Phuket, Thailand, found the body of an Australian man in his room, with authorities saying he was still on a call when he died.

title.children: Young Australian man found dead in Phuket hotel room

image.altText: TS dancers

props.synopsis: The International Court of Justice declared that states do have a "duty to cooperate" on addressing climate change or they risk breaching international law. It raises the question — will the Australian government heed the warning?

title.children: Climate ruling puts Australia on notice, but is Canberra listening?

image.altText: Lauren Black with son Bastian and Grandma Linda

props.synopsis: Lauren says suddenly having to fill the shoes of her mum, which included moving back to her hometown to care for her dad while also raising her toddler, was a strain on her marriage.

title.children: 'Lovers to logistic managers': How caring for aging parents strains relationships

image.altText: A Tibetan man shows a framed portrait of the 11th Panchen Lama, Gedhun Choekyi Nyima.

props.synopsis: China's communist authorities forcibly disappeared the boy chosen to play a major role in the succession of the Dalai Lama, and 30 years on, Tibetan Buddhists continue to resist their attempt to take control.

title.children: Person who would pick next Dalai Lama has been missing for 30 years

image.altText: triple j's Abby & Tyrone wearing Hottest 100 of Australian songs merch laughing together

props.synopsis: This Saturday, we find out what Australia considers to be the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Your guide to the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs

image.altText: Ali France and Albanese

props.synopsis: From the return of federal parliament to a fresh debate on the "spirit of cricket", it's been a big week in news. Test your knowledge.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Federal parliament returns, the 'spirit of cricket' and a top dog
